meanings.definition: Of or relating to the morning.
meanings.sent1: The matinal sunshine warmed the earth gently.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the matinal breeze as she sipped her coffee.
meanings.sent3: The matinal birdsong was her alarm clock every day.
meanings.sent4: The matinal dew on the grass sparkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The matinal glow of dawn painted the sky in pastel hues.

meanings.sent1: The matinal joggers greeted each other with smiles.
meanings.sent2: The matinal traffic was lighter than usual.
meanings.sent3: His matinal routine included a hearty breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The matinal mist enveloped the sleepy town.
meanings.sent5: The matinal delivery of fresh bread was a delight to the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: She attended the matinal at the church every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The matinal was a peaceful start to her day.
meanings.sent3: The matinal echoed softly through the empty chapel.
meanings.sent4: The matinal brought a sense of calm to the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The matinal hymns lifted her spirits and filled her with hope.
